title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 July 2013 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
01:28 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
06:10 <jbwiv\_> has joined #xwiki  
06:55 <geo\_> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <geo\_> Hi We have the LDAP structure as follows:  
07:02 <geo\_> dn: cn=XWikiAdminGroup,ou=wiki.geo.com/xem,ou=Public Sites,ou=Groups,dc=prime,dc=ds,dc=geo,dc=com cn: XWikiAdminGroup member: uid=abdul\_razak,ou=People,dc=prime,dc=ds,dc=geo,dc=com member: uid=geo\_pc,ou=People,dc=prime,dc=ds,dc=geo,dc=com member: uid=roni\_baby,ou=People,dc=prime,dc=ds,dc=geo,dc=com  dn: uid=abdul\_razak,ou=People,dc=prime,dc=ds,dc=geo,dc=com cn: Abdul Razak sn: Razak uid: abdul\_razak mail: [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) userPassword  
07:03 <geo\_> In LDAP Server for an user we have the entries for uid and mail. We had an user on  admin group and with “Ldap UID attribute name” as uid everything is working fine including the login to workspaces with required admin permission.  When we change “Ldap UID attribute name” to mail, user in admin group can able to login to main wiki and have admin privilege but for workspaces he can login but no admin privilege.  Can anyone pleas  
07:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

16:34 <tekzilla> would it be reasonably easy to hook into uploading attachments, so that i could check what kind of file it is and process (eg. convert) it after upload ?  
16:42 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:49 <tekzilla> ok i'll check the "Observation" stuff, sounds like that'll do it  
16:49 <vmassol> tekzilla: yup  
16:50 <vmassol> AttachmentAddedEvent, etc  
16:50 <vmassol> we might be missing AttachmentAddingEvent though if you wish to do something before it's added  
16:56 <tekzilla> vmassol: great, thanks! knowing when it has been added is all i want  
17:20 <Enygma`> vmassol: is it OK to call it "AutoCompletion Application" when it's actually an extension to the "Syntax Highlighting Application" and not an application by itself?  
17:21 <vmassol> I see it as a different app because auto completion is not related to syntax coloring  
17:21 <Enygma`> "AutoCompletion API" is OK because it makes sense by itself  
17:22 <vmassol> we need to separate them more and this is what I'm working on too  
17:22 <vmassol> we should be able to install the autocomplete app without the syntax coloring app IMO  
17:22 <Enygma`> that should not be hard to do  
17:22 <vmassol> yep  
17:23 <Enygma`> ok then, if that is the plan  
17:24 <Enygma`> on a similar note, we`re handling things a bit the wrong way when it comes to syntax highlighting... we`re feeding the whole document content to the autocomplete backend instead of feeding a language for which to get the completions and the content in that language only  
17:25 <vmassol> sure but you need logic to find the language  
17:25 <Enygma`> when it comes to s/syntax highlighting/autocompletion  
17:25 <vmassol> or are you talking about something different?  
17:25 <vmassol> really?  
17:25 <Enygma`> it's the currently active mode  
17:25 <vmassol> bcause we do complex stuff on the server to find that  
17:26 <Enygma`> AFAIK, we can easily get the current mode under the cursor  
17:26 <vmassol> (TargetContentLocator)  
17:26 <Enygma`> and, if it's a multiplexing mode (like "xwiki" is), we can get the innerMode  
17:26 <vmassol> you can check DefaultTargetContentLocator  
17:26 <vmassol> and see if you can have that on the client side  
17:28 <vmassol> I'd like to implement 2 things tomorrow:  
17:28 <vmassol> - support chained methods  
17:28 <Enygma`> thinking more about it... I guess that, for a diferent client of the REST resource, it would be hard to get the language  
17:29 <vmassol> - have auto completion for links: [[label>>  
17:29 <Enygma`> did you notice the TODO I have added on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Syntax+Highlighting+Application ?  
17:30 <vmassol> ah no I didn't thanks for pointing it out  
17:30 <vmassol> I saw the other ones but not this one  
17:30 <Enygma`> I think the most important would be nested macros support  
17:31 <Enygma`> since you can have html inside velocity or the other way around  
17:31 <Enygma`> I remember that for security reasons we have introduced a limitation  
17:31 <Enygma`> but can`t remember what was it exactly  
17:31 <vmassol> nested script macros  
17:31 <vmassol> we disallow that  
17:32 <Enygma`> is html a script macro?  
17:32 <vmassol> no  
17:32 <vmassol> why don't we already support nested macros?  
17:32 <vmassol> hmm need to test that  
17:33 <Enygma`> in the codemirror implementation?  
17:33 <vmassol> nope, server side impl  
17:33 <Enygma`> security issue AFAIK  
17:33 <vmassol> everything is passed to server side  
17:33 <vmassol> no no  
17:33 <vmassol> I meant in the autocompletion  
17:33 <vmassol> :)  
17:33 <Enygma`> ah  
17:33 <vmassol> " ? Hide technical documents"  
17:33 <vmassol> done  
17:33 <Enygma`> yes, noticed :)  
17:35 <Enygma`> was the jira component created before or is it new?  
17:36 <Enygma`> I looked for one (and could not create it myself)  
17:36 <Enygma`> though I was not looking for "Wiki Editor Tools", which is a bit criptic for regular users :)  
17:37 <vmassol> new  
17:37 <vmassol> I added it  
17:37 <vmassol> yes when we vote the integration in the platform we can change the name  
17:37 <Enygma`> :) k  
17:38 <Enygma`> then I should transfer the TODO list to jira issues  
17:41 <vmassol> yes would be nice :)  
17:45 <Enygma`> can I get admin on contrib? or could you please fix the release status of "Wiki Editor Tools 2.0" and 1.x so we can report issues to it?  
17:45 <Enygma`> (on jira)  
17:49 <vmassol> Enygma`: done (for both I think)  
17:50 <Enygma`> thanks  
17:50 <vmassol> gtg, will reconnect later, treasure hunt now here ;)  
17:52 <evalica> has quit  
17:54 <Enygma`> :)  
17:55 <vmassol> actually my team just got eliminated :)  
17:55 <Enygma`> "locate treasure | grep Romania" :P  
17:55 <vmassol> so I'm free  
17:55 <vmassol> hehe  
17:55 <Enygma`> what did you do, find it before the game started?  
17:55 <vmassol> :)  
17:55 <vmassol> it's a 2 part hunt, and only the top 3 teams qualified for the 2nd part  
17:55 <cjd> has quit  
17:56 <vmassol> swimming pool for us then it is!  
17:56 <vmassol> I'll be back after in not too long  
17:56 <Enygma`> ok :)  
17:56 <vmassol> has quit

19:45 <Mariah> hello there  
20:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
20:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
20:20 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
20:28 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
20:29 <jbwiv> has joined #xwiki  
20:29 <jbwiv> anyone know the status of the wiki-stream project?  
20:32 <vmassol> jbwiv: being worked on by thomas...  
20:33 <jbwiv> vmassol: so not in a working state yet?  
20:34 <vmassol> not yet working but soon… :)  
20:34 <vmassol> let's say for XWiki 5.2 since this is the plan  
20:36 <jbwiv> vmassol: ok, cool. fingers crossed ;)  
20:37 <jbwiv> I was unable to secure a budget for converting mediawiki syntax since converting that syntax only enables us to do a full eval of the wiki. they don't want to spend money on it if they're not sure it's what they want yet (even though I'm quite confident). So I have high hopes for wiki-stream  
20:38 <vmassol> too bad ok :)  
20:38 <vmassol> still hope though  
20:39 <Mariah> hello everybody  
20:39 <Mariah> how can i make reference with xwiki sintax to a Space name with blank spaces?  
20:40 <vmassol> [[label>>my space.WebHome]]  
20:40 <Mariah> ok  
20:40 <Mariah> i will try

21:30 <Mariah> <vmassol> many thanks 4 ur answer
